trans-unit.source: Exposes an array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.IValidator"></xref> references.
This class cannot be inherited.
Each <xref:System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection> reference is associated with a validation server control contained on the requested page.
These controls add themselves to this collection when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Init> event of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object is handled.
They remove themselves when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Unload> event of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object is handled.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class inherits both of these methods from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class.
You can access this collection, its methods, and its properties through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.Validators%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
If the tested condition of any validator in this collection fails, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.IsValid%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection"></xref> class.
Adds the specified validation server control to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection"></xref> collection.

When added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.Validators%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IValidator> implementation takes part in validation.
Its <xref:System.Web.UI.IValidator.Validate%2A> method is called together with the <xref:System.Web.UI.IValidator.Validate%2A> methods of all other validators.
All validators then share in determining whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object as a whole is valid.
The validation server control to add.
Determines whether the specified validation server control is contained within the page's <xref href="System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection"></xref> collection.
The validation server control to check for.
`true` if the validation server control is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the validator collection to the specified array, beginning at the specified location.
The collection to which the validation server control is added.
The index where the validation server control is copied.
Gets the number of references in the collection.
The number of validation controls in the page's <xref href="System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection"></xref>.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> instance for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection"></xref> collection.

Use this method to create an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> instance that can be iterated through easily to get each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection> collection.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for the collection.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection"></xref> collection is read-only.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection"></xref> collection is synchronized.
If the collection is synchronized, it is thread safe.
`true` if the collection is synchronized; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the validation server control at the specified index location in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection"></xref> collection.
The index of the validator to return.
The value of the specified validator.
Removes the specified validation server control from the page's <xref href="System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection"></xref> collection.
The validation server control to remove from the collection.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection"></xref> collection.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to synchronize the collection with.
